summary: COS7 cells were grown at 37°C and 5% CO2 in canted neck, vent cap flasks. in some experiments, cells were grown to 90% confluence followed by incubation with serum-free media for 24 h. cell culture media (10 ml) were collected and centrifuged at 10,000 g for 10 min at 4°C. first-strand cDNA synthesis and reverse transcription were performed as described elsewhere (8). primers used to amplify ACE, ACE2, AT1R, and renin transcripts were designed based on human sequences of reference posted in RefSeq database. sequence of ACE2 and ACE RT-PCR fragments produced by using reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) sequences were aligned and matched to human sequences of reference (RefSeq) in silico using geneious software suite R7. cells were grown to 70% confluence on glass coverslips placed in six-well plates, fixed in absolute methanol, and permeabilized with 4% paraformaldehyde containing jugated donkey anti-goat, CY3-conjugated donkey anti-rabbit, or Alexa Fluor 488-conjugated donkey anti-rabbit (Jackson Immunoresearch) antibodies diluted 1:500 with PBS for 2 h at 4°C. cells were washed, air dried, and coverslip mounted over a drop of Vectashield. 125 mmol/l TrisHCl, pH 6.8, 20% glycerol, 0.02% bromophenol blue, and 100 mmol/l dithiothreitol were mixed and boiled for 6 min. protein equivalent samples (2 g protein for COS7 media, 30 g protein for COS7 lysates, and 30 g for kidney homogenates) were loaded and separated by using a 10% SDS-PAGE system. the AT1R antibody/peptide-PBS and AT1R antibody-PBS mixtures were incubated overnight at 4°C. the membranes were washed and incubated with horseradish peroxidase-conjugated secondary antibodies diluted 1:20,000 in TBST at room temperature for 1 h. for ACE2 inhibitor studies, the assay was spiked with 100 M MLN-4760 (MLN) for ACE2 inhibition or 100 M Z-pro-prolinal (ZPP) for prolyl carboxypeptidase/prolyl endopeptidase inhibition. mass spectra were obtained using an autoflex III smartbeam MALDI TOF/TOF instrument. clones of COS7 cells stably expressing short hairpin (sh)RNAs were harvested by trypsin digestion and seeded on six-well plates to attain an approximate confluence of 75%. cells were washed three times with PBS and transfected with 2.5 g of pGIPz-GFP.shADAM17. each flask was split into four flasks for permanent stocks and further characterization. fluorescence was measured at an excitation of 328 nm. TA-free buffer containing protease inhibitors and 2.5 mmol/l phenylmethanesulphonyl fluoride. cells were washed with cold PBS and harvested in complete lysis-M EDTA-free buffer containing protease inhibitors. total protein content was determined using Bradford reagent. ACE2 and ACE primers were used to determine nucleotide sequence of the ACE2 and ACE PCR fragments produced by using reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) sequences of fragments were aligned and matched to human sequences of reference (RefSeq) in silico. cells were washed, air dried, and coverslip mounted over a drop of Vectashield. the primary antibody was combined with five times its concentration of blocking peptide (sc-1173 P; Santa Cruz Biotechnology) the AT1R antibody/peptide-PBS and AT1R antibody-PBS mixtures were incubated overnight at 4°C. cells were washed with cold PBS and incubated with 1:500 diluted secondary CY3-conjugated donkey anti-rabbit IgG. rabbit anti-AT1R antibody was combined with five times its concentration of blocking peptide sc-1173 P in 500 l of PBS. the primary antibody was combined with five times its concentration of blocking peptide sc-1173 P in 500 l of PBS. the membranes were washed and incubated with horseradish peroxidase-conjugated donkey anti-rabbit. enzymatic RAS activities were measured using matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization (MALDI) mass spectrometry. for renin activity, COS7 cell lysates (10–20 g protein) were incubated for 5 min at 37°C in 25 mM bicine buffer pH 7.6. for ACE activity, COS7 cell lysates (10–20 g protein) were incubated for 60 min at 37°C. the assay was spiked with 100 M MLN-4760 (MLN) for ACE2 inhibition or 100 M Z-pro-prolinal (ZPP) for prolyl carboxypeptidase/prolyl endopeptidase inhibition. the reaction was stopped by acidification with trifluoroacetic acid (TFA; final concentration 1%) -GFP.shADAM17 (Open Biosystems, Lafayette, CO) using Lipofectamine2000 (Invitrogen) according to manufacturer's instructions. cells were washed and observed under an inverted fluorescence microscope. cells were harvested, diluted 1:1,000, and replated in 24-well plates. SR-NH2 was measured at an excitation of 328 nm and emission of 393 nm using a Fusion Packard plate reader. a value of P 0.05 was considered statistically significant. total protein content was determined using Bradford reagent (Bio-Rad, Hercules, CA) with bovine serum albumin as a standard. potential contamination of genomic DNA was eliminated by treating RNA samples with DNAse I. first-strand cDNA synthesis and reverse transcription were performed as described elsewhere (8). ACE2 and ACE RT-PCR fragments were aligned and matched to human sequences of reference (RefSeq) in silico using geneious software suite R7 (Biomatters, Auckland, NZ; www.geneious.com). mRNA levels were determined as internal control. rabbit anti-ADAM17 (1:200; cat. no. ADI-905-249-100; Enzo Life Sciences, Farmingdale, NY), and rabbit anti-mannosidase II (1:100; cat. no. LS-B9328, LifeSpan Biosciences, Seattle, WA) diluted in 3% normal donkey serum overnight at 4°C. cells were washed with cold PBS and incubated with secondary CY3-conjugated donkey anti- protein expression of renin, ACE, ACE2 and AT1R proteins in mouse kidney homogenates, COS7 cell lysates, and media was determined using 10% SDS-PAGE. equal volumes of cell lysates or media were mixed and boiled for 6 min. rabbit anti-AT1R antibody was combined with five times its concentration of blocking peptide sc-1173 P in 500 l of PBS. the primary antibody was combined with five times its concentration of blocking peptide sc-1173 P in 500 l of PBS. for ACE2 activity, COS7 cell lysates (10–20 g protein) were incubated for 60 min at 37°C in 50 mM MES buffer pH 6.75. for ACE2 activity, the assay was spiked with 100 M MLN-4760 (MLN) for ACE2 inhibition or 100 M Z-pro-prolinal (ZPP) for prolyl carboxypeptidase inhibition. mass spectra were obtained using an autoflex III smartbeam MALDI TOF/TOF instrument (Bruker Daltonics) a total of 10,000 laser shots was acquired randomly for each spot in the range of m/z 500-3,000 at a laser frequency of 100 Hz. signals for peptide products were fragmented using the Bruker Lift method and identified upon comparison to standard peptides. individual GFP-positive and puromycin-resistant colonies were scraped-off plates and seeded in 25-cm2 flasks. each flask was split into four flasks for permanent stocks and further characterization. the nucleotide sequences corresponding to ACE2 and ACE are >95% identical to human ACE2 and ACE cDNAs. together, these results suggest that the RAS system is expressed at the transcript level in COS7 cells. protein expression of renin (41 kDa), ACE (60 kDa), ACE2 (60 kDa) and AT1R (43 kDa) in COS7 cell lysates was ascertained by using Western blotting. AT1R was not detected in Western blots incubated with AT1R blocking peptide. AT1R (43 kDa) and -actin (42 kDa) were detected in COS7 cells. immunohistochemistry was performed to confirm the concept that RAS components are present in COS7 cells. to further substantiate the concept that RAS components are present in COS7 cells, immunohistochemistry was performed. a sensitive and selective mass spectrometric approach was used to determine endogenous RAS enzymatic activity in COS7 cell lysates and media. this technique allows for the detection of ANG products formed in cells and media incubated with the natural RAS peptide substrates. enzymatic activity was detected by incubating COS7 lysates with the renin substrate tetradecapeptide (m/z 1,758). ANG-(1–7) formation from ANG II in COS7 media in absence or in presence of ACE2 inhibitor MLN-4760 (MLN; 100 M) or prolyl carboxypeptidase/prolyl endopeptidase inhibitor ZPP (100 M) or a combination of both. analysis of GFP expression in selected COS7 cells showed a high percentage of successfully transfected cells. ADAM17 expression in stably transfected cells was analyzed by Western blot and showed a nearly complete silencing of ADAM17 expression in these cells. these results were further corroborated in the immunohistochemical analysis showing a complete downregulation of ADAM17 in silenced cells. ACE2 protein expression was significantly reduced in sh.ADAM17 compared with media of normal cells. ADAM17 is directly involved in the ectodomain shedding of ACE2. expression of ACE2 in media of normal and silenced cells. renin, angiotensin converting enzyme-2 (ACE2), ACE, and GAPDH mRNAs were detected by PCR. each primer set was designed to produce amplicons of 566 bp for renin; 575 bp for AT1R; 679, 608, 599, and 567 bp for ACE2; and 593 and 528 bp for ACE. the size of COS7 AT1R and renin was comparable to the size observed in mouse kidney homogenates. a 195-kDa band was not detected for ACE and a 100-kDa band was not detected for ACE2 in COS7 lysates. immunohistochemistry was performed to confirm the concept that RAS components are present in COS7 cells. renin was localized in the cytoplasm, ACE was localized in the nucleus, and AT1R was localized in the nucleus and cell surface. specificity of the AT1R antibody was tested in incubations with the blocking peptide directed against the AT1R antibody. ANG-(1–7) formation in lysates was not inhibited by the ACE2 inhibitor MLN. ANG-(1–7) formation in media from ANG II was completely abolished. ANG-(1–7) formation was formed in media from ANG II. ANG-(1–7) formation from ANG II in COS7 media in absence or in presence of ACE2 inhibitor MLN (100 M) or prolyl carboxypeptidase/prolyl endopeptidase inhibitor ZPP (100 M) or a combination of both. western blot analysis and quantitation of ADAM17 expression in normal and silenced COS7 cells. ACE2 protein expression was significantly reduced in sh.ADAM17 compared with media of normal cells. expression of RAS at the transcript level in COS7 cells. the nucleotide sequences corresponding to ACE2 and ACE are >95% identical to human ACE2 and ACE cDNAs. together, these results suggest that the RAS system is expressed at the transcript level in COS7 cells. total RNA was reverse transcribed to cDNA and angiotensin II type 1 receptor (AT1R) renin (41 kDa), ACE (60 kDa), ACE2 (60 kDa) and AT1R (43 kDa) were detected in COS7 cell lysates. we incubated Western blots with AT1R antibody in presence of the blocking peptide directed against the AT1R antibody. protein expression of renin, ACE, and AT1R was confirmed in COS7 cells. renin was localized in the cytoplasm and ACE in the nucleus. ACE2 was localized in the perinuclear region of COS7 cells and colocalized with mannosidase II. ACE activity was detected by incubating COS7 lysates with the renin substrate tetradecapeptide (TDP) (m/z 1,758) and showing the formation of ANG I (m/z 1,296; Fig. 5A) ANG-(1–7) formation in COS7 lysates was not inhibited by the ACE2 inhibitor MLN, while ZPP, a prolyl carboxypeptidase/prolyl end ANG-(1–7) formation from ANG II in COS7 lysates in absence or in presence of 100 M ACE inhibitor captopril. ANG-(1–7) formation from ANG II in COS7 media in absence or in presence of ACE2 inhibitor MLN-4760 (MLN; 100 M) or prolyl carboxypeptidase/prolyl endopeptidase inhibitor Z-pro-prolinal (ZPP; 100 M) or Western blot analysis and quantitation of ADAM17 expression in normal and silenced COS7 cells showed a nearly complete silencing of ADAM17 expression. results were further corroborated in immunohistochemical analysis showing a complete downregulation of ADAM17 in silenced cells. western blot analysis of ACE2 in COS7 lysates and cell culture media of normal and silenced cells. A: expression of ACE2 in media of normal and silenced cells. B: expression of ACE2 in media of normal and silenced cells. shorter fragments of ACE and ACE2 observed in COS7 cells may be due to feedback mechanisms to the growth conditions in high glucose medium. results also show that ANG-1-7 (m/z 899) was formed from ANG II (m/z 1,046) in cell lysates and media. lysates ACE2 can be formed by prolyl endopeptidase (50, 58), prolyl carboxypeptidase (43), neprilysin (50, 55), thimet oligopeptidase (36), and neurolysin (36) the present study indicates a high abundance of alternative ANG-(1–7)-forming enzymes in COS7 cell lysates but not cell media. shedding of soluble ACE2 has been described in several studies including human proximal tubular HK-2 cells (38), mouse proximal tubular primary cells (54), and ACE2-transfected Chinese hamster ovary cells (CHO) (22). ADAM17, a sheddase of tumor necrosis factor- and several integral proteins, is expressed in the proximal tubules of the mouse kidney (6, 38) the results challenge previous studies suggesting the lack of RAS expression in COS7. the amenable nature of the COS7 cell line makes it an attractive in vitro model for studying ectodomain shedding of ACE2 mediated by ADAM17. N.G., M.DF., N.K., and K.M.E. drafted manuscript; N.G., M.DF., N.K. edited and revised manuscript; N.G., M.DF., N.K., and K.M.E. approved final version of manuscript.
